ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you tested positive for COVID-19 by a medical professional in the past?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No, I have been tested but the test was negative; 3= No, I have not been tested by a medical professional; 77=Refused; 88=Missing; -99=NA

ElementDescription: How long ago were you tested? (# of days)
Have you recovered (i.e., do you currently test negative) from your COVID-19 diagnosis?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; 77=Refused; 88=Missing; -99=NA

ElementDescription: How long did it take for you to recover (# days)?
Notes: 1= Days; 2= I was asymptomatic; 77=Refused; 88=Missing; -99=NA

ElementDescription: How long do you think your symptoms will last (# days)?
Notes: 1= Days; 2= I was asymptomatic; 77=Refused; 88=Missing; -99=NA

ElementDescription: Days it took to recover from COVID-19 Diagnosis.
Days the participant thinks their symptoms will last.
How long ago were you tested? (# of days)
Session
Duration of survey completion, in seconds.
Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Vignette subversion type.
Notes: 0=Full version; 1=No treatment; 2=Alternative treatment; 3Main treatment

ElementDescription: Text of vignette presented to participant.
First question presented to participant following the vignette.
Participant's answer to the first question presented following the vignette.
Second question presented to participant following the vignette.
Participant's answer to the second question presented following the vignette.
Symptoms in vignette version.
Notes: 1= Low. No fever, but has fatigue and stomach cramps, stays at home; 1=Med. A fever of 101iF (38iC) and difficulty breathing, stays at home; 3=High. A fever of 104iF (40C), is hospitalized.

ElementDescription: Alternative treatment in vignette version.
Outcome in vignette version.
Notes: 0=R (Recovery) Within 5 days all symptoms disappear; 1= NR (No Recovery) Symptoms show little change after 7 days.

ElementDescription: Age in years
How often do you discuss with or hear from the following groups of people about COVID-19? Family members and friends
Notes: 1 = less than once a month; 2 = 1-2 times a month; 3 = once a week; 4 = a few times a week; 5 = every day

ElementDescription: How often do you discuss with or hear from the following groups of people about COVID-19? Leaders in your community
Notes: 1 = less than once a month; 2 = 1-2 times a month; 3 = once a week; 4 = a few times a week; 5 = every day

ElementDescription: How often do you discuss with or hear from the following groups of people about COVID-19? People in different parts of your country
Notes: 1 = less than once a month; 2 = 1-2 times a month; 3 = once a week; 4 = a few times a week; 5 = every day

ElementDescription: How often do you discuss with or hear from the following groups of people about COVID-19? People in other countries
Notes: 1 = less than once a month; 2 = 1-2 times a month; 3 = once a week; 4 = a few times a week; 5 = every day

ElementDescription: How often do you discuss with or hear from the following groups of people about COVID-19? People you consider experts on this topic
Notes: 1 = less than once a month; 2 = 1-2 times a month; 3 = once a week; 4 = a few times a week; 5 = every day

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Family members
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Friends
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Co-workers
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? News agencies
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Social media
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Scientific papers
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Announcements / reports from the World Health Organization (WHO)
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Announcements from the official health protection agency in my country (CDC for US residents)
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Announcements made by the head of my country (President Trump for US residents)
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent have you been getting information about COVID-19 from the following resources? Announcements made by the head of my district (such as state, province; if apply. If not, choose the lowest value)
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = none at all; 25 = a little; 50 = a moderate amount; 75 = a lot; 100 = all

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? The number of known cases of COVID-19 in my country / state
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? The number of COVID-19 related deaths in my country / state
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? The number of known cases of COVID-19 in other countries
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? The number of COVID-19-related deaths in other countries
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Scientific papers published about COVID-19
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Public health-related guidelines (such as social distancing) in my state / country
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Public health-related guidelines in other countries
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Information about economic impact of COVID-19 (such as (un)employment rate) in my country
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Personal health-related events
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Personal financial-related events
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Personal social-related events
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Personal mental-related events
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much

ElementDescription: To what extent the following sources / events affected your beliefs about COVID-19? Other personal events
Notes: Continuous scale with labels: 0 = not at all; 100 = very much
